Reviews.Title: New Look - Great Price
Reviews.Author: Heidi Overstreet
Reviews.Content: This is very light weight and easy to travel with. I love how the charge connects on the side not on the back. Windows 8 is a bit of a learning curve but it easy to navagate. This computer is quite and processes at a fast rate. Would not buy if you are super in to graphics, but for basic gaming/ youtubing it is great.  Connects to the HDMI for tv use great.

Reviews.Title: Good computer
Reviews.Author: Sumeet Mhaskar
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great computer in terms of price. The home and num lock button takes a little while to adjust. Windows 8 looks promising but the skype app is terrible. Other than that so far I am enjoying it. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: PROS: Good Quality and Price.CONS: Much stain with fingerprints. If you don't like it. Do not touch your self or wear glove.

Reviews.Title: I love my laptop!
Reviews.Author: Eloisa Thurman
Reviews.Content: I have had this laptop for  months now and I absolutely love it.  The only drawback is the battery life.  It doesn't last quite as long as some other laptops.  Overall, it's a fine laptop for me (a college student and online shopping addict).  This would be great for anyone!  One more thing:  the picture is more brown than the actual computer.  You can barely tell its brown, only in certain lights.  But, the color barely even matters.

Reviews.Title: Very Bad/Poor Warrantee service and support
Reviews.Author: Fl. Jim
Reviews.Content: After 2.5 months and 1.5 months past the return to Amazon time limit. I started having problems that degenerated till I no longer was able to boot. called the friendly Filipino?? warrantee service and after several hrs of trying this and that they said they would just send me the factory reinstall disk's. Tried reinstalling 5 different times with and without the friendly barely English talking girl's. Not able to do it....They then sent me a second set of disk as most of the time that was the problem??? Tried again to install with same results...Got the official permission to send it in for repair on my dime of course.....Just got it back yesterday, found the paper on what was fixed ( replaced the hard drive) Also had the check off sheet where it showed all the operational items that a functioning computer would require....All passed and were signed of. Fired it up and got the Seattle Washington background with the current Pacific time...I live in Fla, it was fixed in Texas.Ok not a biggie Clicked on that and got a screen with an Administer symbol with a password required??? I did not ever have a password on it at anytime.. They replace the hard drive and of course could not have got a password even if there were one! Called Warrantee and they of course after many hrs of unproductive blathering in pigeon English told me to do a reinstall with the factory disk they had sent earlier. You have two choices when doing an install mfg or a clean install....Was told emphatically I needed to do the clean install...Clean install did not give me what originally came on the computer!!! After several more talks ending with a laughing supervisor who said I needed to do the mfg install. I hung up in disgust and have been installing missing parts for the past two days...Lenovo? Never again!! And when it dies again a Target it will be.

Reviews.Title: This is working very well for us
Reviews.Author: David Dyer-Bennet "dd-b"
Reviews.Content: It's not, obviously, a powerhouse for video editing, gaming, or even Photoshop.  But that's obvious from the specs.My wife uses it regularly for web browsing, email, and for writing (she's writes professionally).  It does all those things just fine, and the wireless works very reliably both here and on other wireless networks.This is a good, solid, workhorse system for that kind of use, and quite inexpensive.  That was the combination we needed.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality,, Lenovo never let me down.
Reviews.Author: J. Mah "Marcus"
Reviews.Content: Compared to other computer makers, Lenovo is the best..When it comes to its design , Lenovo is not that good , but if you consider its performance, reliability and durability the most  ,, you definitely should to with Lenovo computers.And my second choice would be ASUS ,, Acer the 3rd .. etc..Never go with HP ( the worst ) , Samsung , Dell ..FYI , I've been working at computer repair shop for several years.=]

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: PROS: This is a pretty solid laptop for such a good price.  Boots up quick, keyboard is big, separate number pad is convenient.CONS: Touchpad is a little cumbersome, easy to hit it by accident when typing.  Audio jack is an audio/mic combo jack, not 2 separate jacks, which I didn't realize when I bought it.  Biggest CON so far: it has to come with Windows 8.Overall, it is a good laptop, biggest complaint is I would have preferred Windows 7, but I'm glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: hate it
Reviews.Author: ann king
Reviews.Content: I just cant stand this laptop. The keys are hard to push and it is confusing to use. Hate it

Reviews.Title: Good Value Laptop
Reviews.Author: Sir Wes
Reviews.Content: As far as the hardware, it has been great.  Fast, clear picture, good sound quality.  We have used it mainly for watching DVDs and using the internet.  Some of the programs loaded onto this computer seem very unnecessary, but are easy to remove.  Windows 8 is a little bit hard to navigate, but that is the operating system, not the computer.The great price and good speed made this a good value for a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Laptop from Lenovo
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Nelesen
Reviews.Content: I had not purchased this product in the past but, it had great reviews. A laptop is laptop but, I wanted to make sure my daughter had a good one for her first year in college. The "preloaded" software is a nuisance and I had to go in and remove it all before I gave it to her so she didn't get roped in to any "free" programs that she wouldn't need. :) I also have to say that because I have been solely a MAC user for years, that Windows 8 is nothing to write home about. When Microsoft "updates" it software one would expect a better experience with these "new" tools. That is not the case, it's the same old crap just moved around and more expensive. Of course, we do live in a capitalistic world, so way to make money Microsoft without actually improving anything.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 is a detractor
Reviews.Author: J. Grove
Reviews.Content: Why, please tell me, why do they mess up a PC as good as this one by installing Windows 8 on it? Were it not for that it would have gotten a much better rating.  For crying out loud, MS-DOS was a better way to go!  Other than that it's pretty slick.

Reviews.Title: Solid
Reviews.Author: keith caskey
Reviews.Content: Great laptop for most things. I use this laptop mostly for media and programming. It handles both very well. Some minor issues with the touchpad, nothing to get your panties in a twist about. Overall a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Perfect daily driver & more
Reviews.Author: Daniel P
Reviews.Content: I've only had this laptop for a couple weeks.  I got it to replace my 5+ year old Lenovo X61.  I'm very satisfied with this purchase. Great specs for a low price, and I've grown to really trust Lenovo.There weren't too many pre-installed programs to uninstall.  The screen is bright, the battery lasts as long as I need it too (~4 hours). 2 USB 3.0 ports, and an HDMI out is awesome.  The Pentium processor is a lot faster than I thought it'd be.  I still haven't tried gaming on it, but I'm confident it could run Skyrim pretty well with what I've seen from it so far.

Reviews.Title: I expected much better
Reviews.Author: Mr.Danvers
Reviews.Content: I had an issue with this laptop where the screen went dim when the adapter was plugged in. After much searching online i find out it's a rather common issue with Lenovo Laptops and had to use a workaround fix because even Lenovo doesn't know whats wrong with their product.Stick with Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Total Lenovo Configuration Screwup
Reviews.Author: Howard
Reviews.Content: I fired up my new G580 and found that the C partition was 418 gigabytes and the D partition was 25 gigabytes.  But, if you ever have to recover your system using Lenovo's one touch recovery solution it will completely reinitialize the C partition wiping out any personal data you may have stored on it.  So, there are over 300 gigabytes on the C drive that can't be used for critical data.  I also found out that if I repartition the hard drive to make it usable then the one touch recovery system won't work.This is a total configuration screw up.  I can't find anyone at Lenovo who can provide a logical explanation for this.Be aware if you want a usable computer.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo G580
Reviews.Author: Ray Foisel
Reviews.Content: I have Lenovo G580 Laptop purchased from Office depot Last December its has pre-installed Windows 8 64-bit operation system working Fast that I did Upgraded New Windows 8.1 Preview working Successfully like New Windows 8.1 Start Themes now avialable Desktop Background Picture and choose Colors in it Start Menu & Lock Screen Slideshow really, I think Seagate 500GB Hard drive was stopped works 6 Mouth that I did turn Computer in this Morning and died hard 1 Hours that I had sold New Western Digital 500Gb install in this computer but it doesn't Windows 8 install New Hard Drive, My Dad have Called Lenovo Technician will received a Lenovo Recovery Discs with Windows 8 there is Product Key is embedded in Computer's Motherboard now that also "Windows is Activated" in it is working its don't have Lost Windows 8 Product Key now its so better My Computer is Fine working Lenovo G580 Drivers Software is in Recovery Discs had Included.
